title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.0, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/0/ code_of_conduct.html. title: Contributing to clustifyr
text: Thank using helping improve scmetadata. discussion bugs, fixes, feature enhancements greatly appreciated.

title: Contributing to clustifyr
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to clustifyr
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed).

title: Contributing to clustifyr
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("rnabioco/clustifyr", fork = TRUE). Install development dependences devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html. *. Increase version numbers README.md DESCRIPTION new version Pull Request represent. *. Please request code review Pull Requests. sign-two developers, may merge updated code.

title: Contributing to clustifyr
text: New code follow Bioconductor style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to clustifyr
text: Please note clustifyr project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

title: Recommendations for improving single cell GEO record annotations
text: Require analysts provide metadata table containing cell-level metadata count matrix RNA abundance measurements. cell-level metadata contain cell identifiers present matrix provide inferred cell-type cell-level annotations described associated publication. binary object saved analysis framework also supplied (.rds R .h5ad Python). reviewing single-cell sequencing studies, ensure authors deposited proper cell-level metadata alongside raw data suitable repository (e.g. GEO, ArrayExpress). Encouraging previous depositors single-cell sequencing data update records cell-level metadata, included original submission.

title: Recommendations for improving single cell GEO record annotations
text: Include language requirements/recommendation external single-cell datasets contain proper cell-level metadata. Ask reviewers review material deposited external data repositories.

title: Recommendations for improving single cell GEO record annotations
text: Public repositories introduce standardized annotation specifies dataset contains single cell data. GEO, commonly used single cell sequencing methods added library strategy annotation (e.g. scRNA-seq, snRNA-seq, CITE-seq, etc.). Updating submission guidelines require metadata cell-level annotations single cell dataset submissions. GEO, accomplished updating “Processed data files” requirements outline required data types single-cell sequencing submissions. “single-cell sequencing data, addition standard count matrices (genes--cells), expect users deposit metadata cell-level annotations generated course analysis.”

what: Monitoring metadata availability of scRNA-seq data in GEO
title: Monitoring metadata availability of scRNA-seq data in GEO
text: Cell-type annotations frequently excluded public single cell datasets. hinders single cell sequencing analysis reproducibility accessibility. better describe issue, monitor GEO entries monthly (currently set auto-update 1AM UTC, 1st month), programmatically determine fraction entries (potentially, likely overestimated) usable cell metadata. Descriptions issue suggestions (short: PLEASE PLEASE deposit metadata cell level scRNA-seq data) now published PLoS Biology. Supplemental data files related manuscript located inst/manuscript/ directory. Additional thoughtful guidelines organizing scRNA-seq sample cell metadata discussed Füllgrabe et al. latest archive GEO scRNA-seq records associated data can directly downloaded current_geo.rds. GEO filtering, preview first lines text files, content .tar, spot check feedback can accessed last tab clustifyr web app. initial presentation issue (10–17–2020), number frustratingly low 0.122. Current fraction GEO metadata: 0.1694831. comparison, ArrayExpress 10x datasets, fraction 0.1487179). Number depositions updated metadata records since description issue : 0. Please also see full report page.
